newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks tumble 1.72 pct to new year-low.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks tumble 1.72 pct to new year-low.

text.p: Pakistani stocks closed below 1,400 points on Wednesday after sliding on worry about renewed U.S. attacks on Iraq and economic gloom, brokers said.
The Karachi 100-share index fell 24.26 points, or 1.72 percent, to end at 1,387.96, hitting a new year-low.

"There is no postive news to halt the index's slide," dealer Sajjad Mankani said. "A grim economic outlook, coupled with concerns about a regional conflict as a result of U.S. attacks on Iraq, dragged down the index below the 1,400-point mark."
